title: Leveraging Procedural Knowledge and Task Hierarchies for Efficient Instructional Video Pre-training
author: Irfan Essa (Georgia Institute of Technology), Karan Samel (Georgia Institute of Technology), Nitish Sontakke (Georgia Institute of Technology), ..., Irfan Essa (Google DeepMind)
relevance_why: The techniques of leveraging task hierarchies and procedural steps could inspire methodologies for structuring audio generation tasks or step-based transformations in Haohe Liu's research on audio synthesis.
background: The paper focuses on improving the pre-training of instructional video models to effectively predict tasks and steps, enabling better video recommendations and user engagement.
contribution: This paper introduces a model called Pivot which combines procedural knowledge and hierarchical task data to enhance instructional video pre-training, achieving improved performance on downstream tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often rely on implicit learning of video relationships, which can be inefficient and data-intensive.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work explicitly leverages prior knowledge about task hierarchies and procedural steps, enabling effective training even with limited data.

key_innovation: Utilizes explicit task hierarchies and procedural step mining for pre-training, leading to a more efficient model capable of understanding complex video content.
real_world_impact: The improved pre-training of models for instructional videos can enhance user experiences in educational platforms, making it easier to learn tasks through video content.
limitations: No specific limitations were mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.MIL-NCE: **Multiple Instance Learning with Noise Contrastive Estimation** is a method used to improve the training of embeddings by leveraging noise samples during learning.
